meanings.definition: A foot-operated lever used for powering a bicycle or other vehicle.
meanings.sent1: I pressed the pedal to make the bike go faster.
meanings.sent2: She used her foot to push down on the pedal and move the car.
meanings.sent3: The pedal on the bike was stuck, so I couldn't ride it.
meanings.sent4: His foot on the pedal was like a powerful engine propelling him forward.
meanings.sent5: The shiny pedal gleamed in the sunlight as she rode her bike.

meanings.sent1: He will pedal the bike up the hill.
meanings.sent2: She likes to pedal quickly when riding her bicycle.
meanings.sent3: I will pedal the sewing machine to make it work.
meanings.sent4: The musician pedaled the piano gracefully during the performance.
meanings.sent5: Pedal as fast as you can to reach the finish line first.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the foot.
meanings.sent1: The pedal bone is connected to the foot.
meanings.sent2: She wore comfortable shoes that provided good pedal support.
meanings.sent3: The pedal injury made it hard for him to walk.
meanings.sent4: The pedal movement was essential for the dance routine.
meanings.sent5: The pedal muscles were sore after the long hike.
